summary: The Tropical Plant Health Initiative Act (H.R. 5562) amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to provide research and extension grants focused on tropical plant health. The bill targets plant pests and noxious weeds affecting various tropical plants (coffee, macadamia, cacao, plantains, bananas, mangos, floriculture, vanilla, and others). The grants will fund research, data collection, and integrated pest management programs. The bill also changes the authorization of appropriations, shifting the year from 2023 to 2030.
